Title: Open Data Seminar Teaching Materials
Description: The seminar provides an overview of making data freely available (open data) and the subsequent use of such data. It offers insights into how data can be effectively shared, archived, and made reusable in the long term. Participants will learn how to select appropriate repositories, ensure the discoverability and accessibility of their data, as well as search for useful datasets and cite them correctly. The seminar consists of a mixture of lectures and practical exercises in the group and on the PC. It is intended for all-qualification-level researchers.
Keywords: open data * open science * research data management * repositories
